doc.title: Copyright etc.
doc.para:
Copyright / License See license.txt included with the SDK. Here are some copyright and licensing FAQs or things that many will ask. The principle is as described in license.txt, so be sure to read license.txt. If there is a conflict between what is written here and what is written in license.txt, what is written in license.txt takes precedence.
Do I have to pay the creator of Kirikiri?
You don't have to.
I want to use it for commercial use (including shareware) ...
Also available for commercial use. No license fee is required for commercial use. Available free of charge.
I would like to borrow a name from the work...
In particular, there is no need to write in the documentation that you used Kirikiri. Of course, you can write it (^^; Unless otherwise stated, the license indication displayed in -about cannot be deleted. When the license indication is described in the document etc. according to the modified BSD license, the license indication displayed by -about can be deleted.
When the work is completed, do I need to inform the author of Kirikiri?
There is no obligation to notify that you used Kirikiri. There is no obligation to notify you, even for commercial use. But I'm glad to say a word, yes.
I would like to modify the Kirikiri source...
Kirikiri Z is a modified BSD license. Sources can also be modified under the modified BSD license.

Acknowledgments Kirikiri 2 and Kirikiri Z are established with the cooperation of many people. Thank you for your kindness. In particular, Mr. PIA received a lot of advice regarding Kirikiri / KAG. Thank you very much.
Kirikiri Z was developed by crowdfunding and with the financial support of many people. The people who helped me (in no particular order) are W.Dee, casper, MCF, Biscrat, Blue Cat, nagai, Lou, Masayuki Takagiwa, Eternity, Yun Yun Detective, Ryogo , AZ-UME, Akito Kyo, Katsumasa Tsuneyoshi, Jun Koike, miahmie, Circle Baku, Azanashi, Hashi, Tananaka, Waffle / waffle, Wamsoft, TYPE-MOON, M2.
Go Watanabe provided various plugins including the Win32Ole plugin. Thank you very much.
Kenjo provided Photoshop-compatible blend functions. Thank you very much.
The gamepad code was provided by Kiyobee. Thank you very much.
Kouhei Yanagita provided the KAGParser class documentation and KAG extensions. Thank you very much.
The Kirikiri icon is by MIK. Thank you very much.
Various functions related to movie playback, such as layer-based movie playback, incorporate "movie expansion" by Takemoto Imoto. Thank you very much. http://www.kaede-software.com/
The blur implementation is based on the code provided by yun. Thank you very much.
Mr. mey provided pad-related enhancement patches, String.reverse(), etc. Thank you very much.
The following is a list of programming libraries / support software used by Kirikiri (in no particular order, without titles). Thanks to those who have published useful libraries.
IJG JPEG Library (Independent JPEG Group)
http://www.ijg.org/ This software is based in part on the work of the Independent JPEG Group.
libpng (Guy Eric Schalnat, Andreas Dilger, Glenn Randers-Pehrson, and others)
http://www.libpng.org/pub/png/libpng.html
zlib (Jean-loup Gailly, Mark Adler)
http://www.gzip.org/zlib/
ERINA-Library (L.Entis)
http://www.entis.jp/eri/ ERINA-Library Copyright (C) 2001 Leshade Entis, Entis-soft.
Regex++ (Dr John Maddock)
http://ourworld.compuserve.com/homepages/John_Maddock/regexpp.htm Regex++ Copyright (c) 1998-2000 Dr John Maddock
UPX (Markus F.X.J. Oberhumer & Laszlo Molnar)
http://upx.sourceforge.net/
Shell Component Library (Takashi Ito)
http://www.bekkoame.ne.jp/~itotaka/
NASM, The Netwide Assembler (Simon Tatham, Julian Hall and others)
http://nasm.sourceforge.net/
alink (Anthony A.J. Williams)
http://alink.home.dhs.org/
md5.c (L. Peter Deutsch)
Copyright (C) 1999, 2000, 2002 Aladdin Enterprises. All rights reserved.
libogg/libvorbis (Xiph.Org Foundation)
http://www.xiph.org/

Ogg Vorbis Acceleration project
Kirikiri 2 uses the SSE-compatible FFT calculation code published in Ogg Vorbis Acceleration Project by blacksword inside Phase Vocoder. http://homepage3.nifty.com/blacksword/
A C-program for MT19937 (Makoto Matsumoto and Takuji Nishimura)
http://www.math.keio.ac.jp/matumoto/emt.html
